Back to Franz Schubert

Franz Schubert

Fünf Klavierstücke, D 459

1816

[Wikipedia] · [IMSLP page 1] · [IMSLP page 2]

Total duration: 27' 30"

  • 1. Allegro moderato
  • 2. Scherzo: Allegro
  • 3. Adagio
  • 4. Scherzo con trio: Allegro
  • 5. Allegro patetico

It is not known whether Schubert intended these pieces to be played together as a sonata. The first version of Otto Erich Deutsch’s catalogue of Schubert’s works collects the pieces as Fünf Klavierstücke (D 459), as they were originally published. The second version lists the first two pieces as an incomplete Sonata in E major (D 459) and the last three as Drei Klavierstücke (D 459A).

Recommended editions

  • Neue Schubert-Ausgabe (Bärenreiter) · VII/2/1 · BA 5553 · Klaviersonaten I · ed. Walburga Litschauer [movs. 1–2]
  • Neue Schubert-Ausgabe (Bärenreiter) · VII/2/4 · BA 5525 · Klavierstücke I · ed. David Goldberger [movs. 3–5]
  • Associated Board · Complete Pianoforte Sonatas / Volume I · ed. Howard Ferguson
  • Bärenreiter · BA 9642 · Klaviersonaten I / Die frühen Sonaten · ed. Walburga Litschauer [movs. 1–2]
  • Henle · HN 150 · Klaviersonaten / Band III · ed. Paul Mies
  • Henle · HN 151 · Klaviersonaten / Band III · ed. Paul Mies
  • Wiener Urtext · UT 50220 · Sämtliche Klaviersonaten / Band 1 · ed. Martino Tirimo

1. Allegro moderato

Duration: 6' 30"

Difficulty: 3

2. Scherzo: Allegro

Duration: 5'

Difficulty: 3

3. Adagio

Duration: 5' 30"

Difficulty: 2.5

4. Scherzo con trio: Allegro

Duration: 3' 30"

Difficulty: 2.5

5. Allegro patetico

Duration: 7'

Difficulty: 3.5
